content.description:
Lots of thoughtful moves (one harder than the rest) - with careful route-choices needed.

 Up right a few feet with hands on the narrow diagonal ledge, then aim for the top a few feet right from the 8-inch-thick tree on the top platform near the edge.

warning: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and some of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber or someone setting up top anchor.

 . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2018. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

 FA style + Naming of routes: For more on this - - > See the Main page for Cranberry Hollow.
content.protection:
For ideas how to set up anchor for Top-Roping, see Description page for this sector McEldowney.

 Protection for trad Leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On the main face on the left side of this crag . . . near the center of that face, start at the intersection of the wide crack rising diagonal left and a narrow ledge rising diagonal right.

 - - > See H on this Photo.

content.description:
Thoughtful moves sustained.

 On the main face on the left side of this crag . . . near the center of that face, start at the intersection of the wide crack rising diagonal left and a narrow ledge rising diagonal right. Up left a few feet along the wide crack, then aim for the top just left of the 8-inch-thick tree on the top platform near the edge.

warning: The rock on and near this route has not been climbed much yet, and some of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber or someone setting up top anchor.

 . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2018. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

 FA style + Naming of routes: For more on this - - > See the Main page for Cranberry Hollow.

For ideas how to set up anchor for Top-Roping, see Description page for this sector McEldowney.

 Protection for trad Leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On the main face on the left side of this crag . . . near the center of that face, start at the intersection of the wide crack rising diagonal left and a narrow ledge rising diagonal right.

 - - > See F on this Photo.

content.description:
Short wall with a variety of large features. Routes 20-30 ft, facing mainly WSW.

 Cool weather days nice in afternoon due to favorable exposure. Much is shaded by mature trees, so not as hot as might expect on hot afternoons.

 Top-Roping: Access to set up anchors by top of cliff is by scramblnig up around Right (SE) side, but this as a rather slippery and exposed segment.

 Name: John McEldowney wrote the first guide for New Jersey rock climbing.

warning: Loose rock is still a concern in this sector. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber or underneath a leader setting up top anchor.

 . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2018. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
